title: Pendant Medallion, 2010-31-21, 1928–1929
provenance: Donor purchased the two Grantil sample books from a private collector in France ca. 2000. For the remaining non-Grantil pieces, the French, Belgian and English papers were acquired from various sources in Europe, while the American samples were acquired from private collections in the United States.
description: Irregular-shaped cut-out medallion with a bird, possibly a humming bird, alighted on a flower. Also contains two other different flowers and vining tendrils. Medallion is outlined with narrow band containing metallic gold floral motifs. Printed on airbrushed rust-color ground.
